etymology.description: semantic 囗 + phonetic 元 (simp.); semantic 囗 (‘fence’) + phonetic 袁 (trad.).
etymology.interpretation: An enclosing frame 囗 conveys the idea of a fenced or bounded space, while 元/袁 supplies the sound yuán. Together it evokes an enclosed area used for cultivation or leisure, i.e., a garden or park.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 園 replaced its phonetic 袁 with the simpler 元 inside the enclosure, reducing strokes while keeping the pronunciation yuán.

examples.chinese: 我们去公园散步(我們去公園散步)。
examples.english: We’re going for a walk in the park.

examples.chinese: 这个园子里种满了花草(這個園子裡種滿了花草)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège yuánzi lǐ zhòng mǎn le huācǎo.
examples.english: This garden is filled with flowers and plants.

examples.chinese: 园丁每天打理植物园(園丁每天打理植物園)。
examples.english: The gardener tends the botanical garden every day.
